page.title: 12"THE FARMER'S DAY AND LIFE"
page.content: It's{5.00 am}and my dad is just getting up to milk the cows. We have got{70}cows and about{30}heifers and calves.It takes about{3\}hours to milk them by machine.In{February, March}and {April}it takes longer to{milk}them because the cows have just had their calves.In the{Autumn}it doesn't take so long because most of the cows are dry, which means we don't milk them for about{6 to 8}weeks before they have had their calves. When he has finished he hoses out the parlour. If it's the{summer}then we put the cows out in the field, but in the {winter}we feed the cows{grains}and {silage. {Silage}is cut grass which is stored through the{Autumn}and{sprayed}to help to keep it. We make silage in{May} and {August}and it takes about a week to make.
